servinfo.title: Crank Pin and Connecting Rod Bearings Inspection

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Disassembly and Reassembly:N32A

servinfosub.title: Crank Pin Diameter
servinfosub.ptxt: Inspect crank pin for uneven wear or damage. Measure crank pin for out-of-roundness or taper using micrometer. If crank pin is damaged or out-of round or taper is out of limit, replace crankshaft.

spec.title: Crank pin taper (a, b) and out-of-round (A – B)

servinfosub.title: Connecting Rod Bearing Visual Inspection
servinfosub.ptxt: Inspect bearing shells for signs of fusion, pitting, burn or flaking and observe contact pattern. Defective bearing shells must be replaced.

s1.ptxt: Place a piece of gauging plastic (1) to full width of crank pin as contacted by bearing (parallel to crankshaft), avoiding oil hole.
Install new connecting rod bearing and its cap.
After three minutes, remove cap and using scale (2) on gauging plastic envelope, measure gauging plastic (1) width at the widest point (clearance).
If clearance is out of specification, measure crank pin diameter referring to Crank Pin and Connecting Rod Bearings Inspection:N32A .
If crank pin diameter is out of specification, replace crankshaft.
If crank pin diameter is within specification, replace connecting rod.
